oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A highly enantioselective synthesis of (−)- and (+)-juglomycin A through Dötz annulation and asymmetric dihydroxylation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: FERNANDES, RODNEY A
CHAVAN, VIJAY P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: methylation
synthesis
isomers
temperature
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A highly enantioselective synthesis of (−)- and (+)-juglomycin A, a quinone antibiotic is described. The synthesis is completed in eight steps, and 19% overall yield and in a high enantioselectivity of 99.5% [for (−)-juglomycin A] and 98.5% [for (+)-juglomycin A]. The synthetic strategy features an efficient combination of the Dötz annulation reaction and asymmetric dihydroxylation as the keys steps.
